Grilled Chicken and Spinach Sandwich

Jump to Recipe

Are you craving a delicious and healthful meal that can be whipped up in no time? Look no further than this Grilled Chicken and Spinach Sandwich! Bursting with flavor and packed with nutrients, this sandwich is perfect for a quick lunch or a satisfying dinner. Featuring tender grilled chicken breast marinated in olive oil and seasoned with garlic, paired with fresh spinach and a creamy lemon-infused spread, every bite is a delightful explosion of taste. Plus, with the wholesome goodness of whole grain bread, you can enjoy a meal that not only tastes great but also fuels your body right. In this article, we will guide you through the simple steps to create this mouthwatering sandwich, ensuring you impress your family and friends with your culinary skills while keeping your health in check. Ready to elevate your sandwich game? Let’s dive into the recipe!

Ingredients

boneless chicken breast

Choose chicken breasts that are plump and firm. For added flavor, marinate the chicken in olive oil, garlic, and herbs for at least 30 minutes before grilling. If you don't have chicken breast, you can substitute with chicken thighs for a juicier option, or use grilled tofu for a vegetarian alternative.

fresh spinach

Use fresh spinach for the best flavor and texture. If fresh spinach is not available, you can use baby kale or arugula as substitutes. To enhance the flavor, lightly sauté the spinach in a bit of olive oil and garlic before layering it on the sandwich.

whole grain bread

Opt for a hearty whole grain bread that can hold up to the fillings. If you're gluten-free, use a gluten-free bread or a lettuce wrap. To enhance the flavor, consider toasting the bread with a little olive oil or butter before assembling the sandwich.

olive oil

Use extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. If you're out of olive oil, you can substitute with canola oil, avocado oil, or melted coconut oil. Drizzling a bit of lemon juice over the chicken before grilling can also brighten the flavor.

garlic powder

Garlic powder is a great way to add flavor without the bulk of fresh garlic. If you prefer fresh garlic, use 1-2 cloves minced instead. For a different flavor profile, try substituting with onion powder or smoked paprika.

salt

Salt enhances all the other flavors in your dish. Use kosher salt for seasoning the chicken as it dissolves easily and doesn't overpower. If you are watching sodium intake, consider using a salt substitute or seasoning with herbs instead.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper adds a nice kick. You can also experiment with different types of pepper, such as white pepper or crushed red pepper flakes for heat.

mayonnaise or greek yogurt

Greek yogurt is a healthier alternative to mayonnaise and adds a nice tang. You can also use avocado as a spread for a creamy texture. For a flavor twist, consider adding herbs or spices like dill or smoked paprika to the mix.

lemon juice

Fresh lemon juice brightens up the flavors in the spread. If you don't have fresh lemons, bottled lemon juice can work in a pinch. For a different flavor, consider using lime juice or a splash of vinegar.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Grill

    Preheat your grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat for about 5-10 minutes. This is crucial for achieving those beautiful grill marks and ensuring even cooking.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Chicken

    Rub the boneless chicken breast with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Make sure to coat the chicken evenly for maximum flavor.

  • Step 3: Grill the Chicken

    Place the seasoned chicken breast on the hot grill. Grill for about 6-7 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is fully cooked and registers an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). This ensures the chicken is juicy and safe to eat.

  • Step 4: Prepare the Spread

    While the chicken is grilling, prepare the spread. In a small bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise or Greek yogurt with 1 teaspoon of lemon juice. This adds a refreshing zing to your sandwich.

  • Step 5: Rest and Slice the Chicken

    Once the chicken is done, remove it from the grill and let it rest for 5 minutes. Resting helps retain the juices. After resting, slice the chicken thinly to make it easier to layer in your sandwich.

  • Step 6: Toast the Bread

    Toast the whole grain bread slices on the grill or in a toaster until golden brown. Toasting adds a nice crunch and enhances the flavor of the bread.

  • Step 7: Assemble the Sandwich

    Spread the mayo/yogurt mixture on one side of each slice of bread. On one slice, layer the grilled chicken slices and top with 1 cup of fresh spinach. Place the other slice of bread on top, mayo side down.

  • Step 8: Serve and Enjoy

    Cut the sandwich in half for easier handling and enjoy your delicious grilled chicken and spinach sandwich!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly grill chicken breast without drying it out?

To keep chicken breast juicy, use a meat thermometer to check for doneness (internal temperature should be 165°F/75°C). Marinating the chicken or rubbing it with olive oil helps retain moisture.

What is the best way to wash fresh spinach?

Rinse fresh spinach leaves under cold running water, gently rubbing them to remove any dirt or grit. You can also soak them in a bowl of water, then rinse again.

How can I tell when my chicken is fully cooked?

The safest way to check is by using a meat thermometer. If you don’t have one, cut into the thickest part of the chicken; it should be opaque and the juices should run clear, not pink.

Is there a substitute for mayonnaise in the sandwich?

Yes! You can use Greek yogurt, avocado, or even hummus as a healthier alternative to mayonnaise.

How do I prevent my bread from getting soggy?

To prevent sogginess, toast the bread lightly before assembling the sandwich, and consider spreading the mayo or yogurt mixture just before serving.

What should I do if I don't have a grill?

You can use a grill pan on the stovetop or bake the chicken in the oven at 375°F (190°C) for about 25-30 minutes, checking for doneness.

How can I make this sandwich more flavorful?

You can add herbs like basil or cilantro, slices of avocado, or even a sprinkle of cheese to enhance the flavor of your sandwich.

What is the best way to slice grilled chicken?

Let the chicken rest for a few minutes after grilling to allow the juices to redistribute. Then, slice it against the grain into thin pieces for more tender bites.

How can I safely handle raw chicken?

Always wash your hands, utensils, and cutting boards after handling raw chicken to avoid cross-contamination. Use separate cutting boards for meats and vegetables.

What can I serve with my grilled chicken and spinach sandwich?

Consider serving it with a side salad, fresh fruit, or oven-baked sweet potato fries for a balanced meal.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This sandwich can be made gluten-free by using gluten-free bread. For a lower-calorie version, substitute the mayonnaise with Greek yogurt or a light dressing. Additionally, to cater to those with dietary restrictions like lactose intolerance, ensure to use dairy-free mayonnaise options. For a vegetarian option, substitute the grilled chicken with grilled portobello mushrooms or marinated tofu.

Pairings

For a delightful pairing with the Grilled Chicken and Spinach Sandwich, consider serving it with a side of sweet potato fries or a light quinoa salad. A refreshing beverage such as iced tea or a crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc complements the savory flavors beautifully. For a more casual occasion, pair it with a craft beer, such as a pale ale, to enhance the grilled chicken's flavor.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Grilled Chicken and Spinach Sandwich warm, preferably immediately after preparation to enjoy the contrast of the warm chicken and the fresh spinach. You can add fresh herbs like basil or arugula for an extra layer of flavor. Consider wrapping the sandwich in parchment paper for a rustic presentation, especially for picnics or lunchboxes. A sprinkle of feta cheese on top just before serving can enhance the taste and texture.

Grilled Chicken and Spinach Sandwich

25 min
$5
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 1

Allergens:

Description

A deliciously simple sandwich featuring tender grilled chicken, fresh spinach, and a flavorful spread, perfect for a quick meal.

Ingredients

  • boneless chicken breast: 1
  • fresh spinach: 1 cup
  • whole grain bread: 2 slices
  • olive oil: 1 tablespoon
  • garlic powder: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • mayonnaise or greek yogurt: 2 tablespoons
  • lemon juice: 1 teaspoon
